comments: Well intentioned man, BORING BORING BORING class. He obviously knows his history, but can not teach it. I\'ve had interesting history classes, this is not one of them. If you actually want to learn and not have regurgitated information spit out at you for a couple hours, don\'t take this class.

He is the most useless, boring teacher ever I have seen. He doesn\'t have any real opinion. He asked us for more than 14, 5page written essay, and even him self didn\'t know the answer of his test questions, which is hell embarrassing.
He never used any visual aides. His lectures are very boring. He doesn\'t put much effort in his preparations. If you want to learn, do not take him.

Mr. Anderson is quite possibly the most boring teacher I have ever had. His lectures are relentless and irrelevant and above all UNINTERESTING. I\'ve had history courses that kept me interested, this is NOT one of them. Essays are simple, tests are hard. He\'s nice, but I wouldn\'t recommend him to anyone.

Kevin Anderson is a great teacher. Keeps the lecture fun and has pretty easy assignments. Received a B in his class, and am happy with the grade. If you show up everyday, and participate, you will do fine. The tests are easy and you barely use the book. Just listen to his lectures and don\'t talk when he is talking and your fine.

He requires a total of 5 essays and two tests. There are 3 books required, The Narrative of Frederick Douglass, Give Me Liberty, and Interpretations of American History. You don\'t really use Give me Liberty but you use Interpretations for 4/5 essays. His classes are lectures and discussions. He likes it when people speak up and and ask questions.
If you do 50% of work you will make a C. Almost impossible to fail. Nice guy all around.
boring teacher, alot of reading and esseys
HE SAYS TESTS ARE ON A SINGLE CHAPTER IN BOOK. PROBLEM IS THAT ABOUT 15% OF TEST QUESTIONS ARE NOT MENTIONED IN BOOK OR IN LECTURE. SETS YOU UP TO FAIL. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. PLUS HE IS BORING AS SHIZZ

mr anderson acts all like he is such a hard teacher but I doubt anyone who actually did work failed quiet likeable when you have something to say in class discussions help you understand where he is in the class material. jokes about being so angry all the time just jokes. do work and particapate

Mr. Anderson is a good instructor. He lectures the whole class period, and you rarely use your book. Although, there is a secondary book you are required to use to write papers on. Book is horrible :/... Overall the class isn\'t too hard, but attendance is mandatory.

Whoever said he was easy was lying to you. He is a very boring teacher and talks in a mono tone like he bored. At first I thought he was blind and deaf because he look like it but he watches you every move. It is mandatory to go to every class or he starts bumping you down letter grades. If you like lecture i guess take him.

Its a extremely easy class, if you can withstand his boring lectures. There are NO tests. Your grade consists of 4 easy papers, and a debate. You dont really have to buy the textbook, its not necessary. he just lectures the whole time. The information you need for your papers is all online anyway. Impossible to fail this class.

Not the most interesting teacher, but once he gets comfortable with you he will throw markers at you, or threaten to use his gun. Ex military man. His lectures are off of notes and it can get boring. The summer class flew by and the assignments were easy. Four papers and a book report, and he welcomes some creative freedom. Honor statements require
nasty and cantankerous and not all together fair; his humor is a disguise; dont recommend taking a course with this prof--he\'s very boring

the definition of boring lecture, until the end of the course when the donner party final is a classroom discussion, which then gets interesting; if he would follow the same format thru the entire course, it would be really interesting, but he drones on and on sometimes

It might be easy to do the essays and the final paper but when he talk it is the boring part. I personally like history especially in the beginning, when new things are created just like this class, but he just talks and confuses me all the time. if you can control yourself from sleeping then your good to go.

Boring. All he does is talk and never follows the book, you must sign in every day or he will dock points for attendace. Just 4 assignments for the whole semester. You can literally pass the class by reading the book on your own, it just sucks he recquires you to be there to listen to him drone on.
Extremely easy class. Only 4 writing assignments no real homework other than reading. Easy to pass if you speak up in class. PARTICIPATE in discussions. Taking his 102 as well.

Has lots of knowledge, cares for the students, if you have questions he usually has an answer. Tries to get students to participate--but only 4 or 5 due the rest sit there like bumps on a log probably there just because they have to and they don\'t have a clue whats going on. Lots of writing but have learned more from writing
